conclusion: Diffraction is the bending of waves around obstacles and openings, depending on wavelength and obstacle size.
Light with a longer wavelength diffracts more than light with a shorter wavelength.
Refractive index depends on the frequency of light, increasing with decreasing wavelength.
Light with a higher frequency has a higher refractive index in the glass brick.

Light b must have a longer wavelength compared to light a to exhibit more diffraction.
A longer wavelength means a lower frequency and thus a lower refractive index in the glass brick.
Light b, having a longer wavelength, will diffract more than light a.
